greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to write n = x + y (x, y > 0) with x^4 + y*(y+1)/2 prime.
comment: (ii) For any positive integer n not among 1, 3, 14, 25, there are positive integers x and y with x + y = n such that x^3 + y*(y+1)/2 is prime.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Nov 10 2013
